command.simpleclouds.clouds.get: Cloud type %s is at [%s, %s] and has weather type '%s'
command.simpleclouds.clouds.get.empty: No cloud type is at that position
command.simpleclouds.clouds.spawn.fail: Too many cloud formations close by!
command.simpleclouds.direction.get: Clouds are currently moving in direction [x: %s, y: %s, z: %s] (%s)
command.simpleclouds.direction.set: Successfully set cloud direction to [x: %s, y: %s, z: %s] (%s)
command.simpleclouds.scroll.get: The current cloud scroll position is [x: %s, y: %s, z: %s]
command.simpleclouds.weather.override:
Simple Clouds is overriding vanilla weather, and the /weather command is disabled. To use vanilla weather, please do either of the following:
1. Set the cloud mode in the SERVER config to AMBIENT.
2. Set the cloud mode in the SERVER config to SINGLE, and set the single mode cloud type to a cloud type that has no weather associated with it (e.x. simpleclouds:itty_bitty)
commands.simpleclouds.client.configRefer: This option is overriden by the CLIENT config. Please refer to the CLIENT config to change this option.
commands.simpleclouds.notClientSideOnly: Client cloud commands can only be used when connected to servers that do not have Simple Clouds installed. If you're connected on singleplayer, or you are an operator on a dedicated server with Simple Clouds installed, please use '/simpleclouds clouds'
gui.simpleclouds.cloud_previewer.info:
Welcome to the cloud previewer!

Add, remove, and customize noise layers seen in the left of the screen to create custom cloud types. Use the load button in the bottom right to load existing cloud types to edit them, and use the export button to export your cloud types as JSON files.
gui.simpleclouds.cloud_previewer.popup.e: What would you like to name your cloud type?
A file with that name already exists. Would you like to override it?
Your cloud type has been exported to %s
gui.simpleclouds.cloud_previewer.title: Cloud Previewer
gui.simpleclouds.config.atmosphericCloud: Specifies if a purely visual 2D atmospheric cloud layer should render.
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideCloudH: Specifies the render Y offset for the clouds.
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideCloudM: Specifies how the clouds should behave in a client-side only context. SINGLE uses only a single cloud type. AMBIENT carves clouds around the player, keeping them at a distance. Due to be on a client-side only context, DEFAULT can not be picked and the vanilla weather system will be used. If Simple Clouds is installed on a server, this option will be ignored and the client will instead use the option set by the server.
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideSingle: Specifies the cloud type that should be used when the SINGLE cloud mode is active.
Client Side Single Mode Cloud Type
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideSpeedM: Specifies the movement speed of the clouds.
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudMode.descri: Specifies how the clouds should behave. DEFAULT uses all cloud types with the default weather in Simple Clouds. SINGLE uses only a single cloud type and its associated weather. AMBIENT disables localized weather and carves clouds around the player, keeping them at a distance.
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudMode.title: Cloud Mode
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudSeed.descri: Specifies the seed to use for the clouds. Will apply for all servers that the user connects to with the mod on the client-side only.
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudSeed.title: Cloud Seed
gui.simpleclouds.config.concurrentComput: EXPERIMENTAL. Uses a slightly modified algorithm that removes sync calls between chunk generator compute dispatches at the cost of higher memory usage. May result in a performance boost.
gui.simpleclouds.config.cubeNormals.desc: Specifies if normals should be applied to each individual cube in the cloud which applies a bit of shading per cube face. Helps distinguish each individual cube in a cloud.
gui.simpleclouds.config.customRainSounds: Specifies if new rain sounds should replace the vanilla ones.
gui.simpleclouds.config.dimensionWhiteli: Specifies the allowed dimensions that Simple Clouds is active in
gui.simpleclouds.config.distantShadows.d: Toggles shadows that appear on distant terrain.
gui.simpleclouds.config.fogMode.descript: Specifies the type of world fog that should be used. Each has their own advantages and disadvantages, ranging from visual discrepancies to possible compatibility issues.
gui.simpleclouds.config.fogMode.title: Fog Mode
gui.simpleclouds.config.framesToGenerate: Specifies how many frames it should take to generate the entire cloud mesh. Higher values will improve performance at the cost of stuttery cloud movement.
gui.simpleclouds.config.frustumCulling.d: Culls cloud chunks not visible to the player. Generally should not be disabled, but can fix visual issues when looking around fast with higher frames per mesh generation values.
gui.simpleclouds.config.generateMesh.des: Toggles the generation of the cloud mesh.
gui.simpleclouds.config.generationInterv: How the amount of frames used to generate the entire mesh is calculated. Static will use the 'Frames To Generate Mesh' option. Dynamic will calculate it automatically depending on your FPS. Target FPS will target a certain perceived framerate for mesh generation.
gui.simpleclouds.config.levelOfDetail.de: Specifies the quality of the level of detail. A lower setting makes clouds lower quality faster.
gui.simpleclouds.config.lightningColorVa: Specifies if lightning should have slight random color variation.
gui.simpleclouds.config.lightningSpawnIn: Specifies the longest interval until the next lightning strike will spawn, in ticks.
Specifies the shortest interval until the next lightning strike will spawn, in ticks.
gui.simpleclouds.config.rainAngle.descri: Specifies the angle of the rain, perpendicular to the ground. Higher values makes it more horizontal.
gui.simpleclouds.config.rainAngle.title: Rain Angle
gui.simpleclouds.config.renderCustomRain: Specifies if custom rain rendering should be used. Automatically disabled when using Pretty/Particle Rain.
gui.simpleclouds.config.renderStormFog.d: Specifies if 'rain' beneath storm clouds should appear or not. Disabling can improve performance, especially when in VR.
gui.simpleclouds.config.shadedClouds.des: Specifies if minimal shading should be applied to clouds. May cause performance drops.
gui.simpleclouds.config.shadowDistance.d: Specifies the distance shadows can render.
gui.simpleclouds.config.showCloudPreview: Specifies if the info pop-up should appear when opening the cloud previewer menu.
gui.simpleclouds.config.showVivecraftNot: Shows the Vivecraft notice on startup.
gui.simpleclouds.config.singleModeCloudT: Specifies the cloud type that should be used when the SINGLE cloud mode is active.
gui.simpleclouds.config.singleModeFadeEn: Specifies the percentage of the cloud render distance that the clouds will be fully faded away, when using the single cloud type mode (e.x. 50 would make the clouds completely disappear past half the cloud render distance).
gui.simpleclouds.config.singleModeFadeSt: Specifies the percentage of the cloud render distance that the clouds should begin to fade away, when using the single cloud type mode (e.x. 50 would start to make the clouds fade away at half of the cloud render distance).
gui.simpleclouds.config.stormFogAngle.de: Specifies the angle parellel to the horizon that the storm fog should be directed to.
gui.simpleclouds.config.stormFogLightnin: Toggles lightning flashes that can be seen in storm fog. Disabling can lead to potential performance gains when lightning spawns.
gui.simpleclouds.config.targetMeshGenFps: Used to set the target FPS with the 'Target FPS' option in 'Generation Interval'.
gui.simpleclouds.config.testSidesThatAre: Specifies if faces that are not visible to the camera should be tested during mesh generation. Settings this to off can improve performance at the cost of visual issues with shadows and storm fog.
gui.simpleclouds.config.thunderAttenuati: Specifies the attenuation distance for thunder. The lower the value, the quieter it will be from longer distances.
gui.simpleclouds.config.transparency.des: Specifies if transparent cubes should be generated for supported cloud types. May cause performance drops.
gui.simpleclouds.config.transparencyRend: Specifies the maximum percentage of the total viewable distance transparent cubes can be generated in.
Specifies if the seed set by the 'Cloud Seed' option should be used or not.
gui.simpleclouds.config.whitelistAsBlack: Specifies if the dimension whitelist should instead be use as a blacklist
gui.simpleclouds.debug.title: Simple Clouds Debug
gui.simpleclouds.error.compat.dh_oculus: Simple Clouds does not currently support shaders with Distant Horizons. Please either remove Oculus/Iris to play with Simple Clouds, or remove Simple Clouds to play with shaders.
gui.simpleclouds.error.coreShadersInitia: An error occured while initializing core shaders. If you are modifying them, please see the log for more details. If you are a user, please report this on the Simple Clouds GitHub.
gui.simpleclouds.error.couldNotLoadMeshS:
Failed to load the mesh compute shader. Please make a bug report on the mod's GitHub repository, linked below. Make sure to include the crash report and latest.log file with your issue.

To developers: If you are modifying the cube_mesh.comp file using a resource pack and have made an error, this message will appear on start up. Please see the latest.log for more details.
gui.simpleclouds.error.opengl:
The currently selected display adapter does not support Simple Clouds.

Simple Clouds only supports display adapters that have OpenGL 4.3+ capabilities.

Please make sure:
1. Your drivers are up to date
2. You are not using integrated graphics instead of a discrete GPU to run Minecraft.

If you are a MacOS user, Simple Clouds IS NOT SUPPORTED as the OS is stuck on OpenGL 4.1. Unfortunately, this is a limitation that Simple Clouds cannot work around.
gui.simpleclouds.error.recommendations: Please try updating your graphics drivers. If the issue persists, please make a bug report on the Simple Clouds repository, linked below. Make sure to include the crash report with your issue.
gui.simpleclouds.error.unknown: Please make a bug report on the mod's GitHub repository, linked below. Make sure to include the crash report and latest.log file with your issue.
gui.simpleclouds.error_screen.descriptio: An error occured while initializing Simple Clouds.
gui.simpleclouds.error_screen.multiple: More than one error has occured. Please see the 'crash-reports' folder for more information.
gui.simpleclouds.error_screen.title: Simple Clouds Error
gui.simpleclouds.notice.close.title: Close
gui.simpleclouds.notice.title: Simple Clouds Notice
gui.simpleclouds.notice.vivecraft: Vivecraft support is experimental. Please expect lower framerates, instability, and glitches/visual artifacts. Report bugs and issues on the official GitHub issue tracker.
gui.simpleclouds.reload_confirmation.ser: A config option was modified on the server that requires the cloud renderer to be reloaded. Please press 'Continue' to continue.
gui.simpleclouds.requires_reload.info: A config option was modified that requires the cloud renderer to be reloaded. Would you like to reload the renderer to apply the changes?
gui.simpleclouds.requires_reload_resourc: A config option was modified that requires resource packs to be reloaded. Would you like to reload resources to apply the changes?
gui.simpleclouds.unknown_or_invalid_clie:
Unknown or invalid cloud type '%s'. Please pick a valid cloud type. 

Valid cloud types are as follows:

%s
simpleclouds.config.preset.low.descripti: For systems that are struggling a bit running this mod. Sets the level of detail to the lowest, disables transparency, and makes the cloud mesh generate a bit slower.
simpleclouds.config.preset.medium.descri: For more medium-end systems that can't handle high. Lowers the level of detail and makes the cloud mesh generate a bit slower.
simpleclouds.config.preset.ultra_low.des: If your system is REALLY struggling. Lowest level of detail, no transparency, and disables storm fog.
